name: Math For the Computer Industry
description: This course is designed to provide students with the mathematical knowledge and skills required to solve problems in the computer industry. Topics include: algebra. Students will learn to apply mathematical concepts to solve problems in computer programming, networking, and database management.

name: Introduction to Computer Programming
description: This course is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills required to write computer programs. Topics include: programming languages, data types, control structures, functions, and arrays. Students will learn to write programs in a variety of programming languages.

name: Introduction to Computer Networking
description: This course is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills required to design and implement computer networks. Topics include: network topologies, network protocols, network security, and network management. Students will learn to design and implement computer networks.

name: Introduction to Database Management
description: This course is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills required to design and implement database management systems. Topics include: database design, database normalization, database security, and database management. Students will learn to design and implement database management systems.

name: Introduction to Web Development
description: This course is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills required to design and implement web applications. Topics include: web design, web development, web security, and web management. Students will learn to design and implement web applications.

name: Introduction to Mobile Development
description: This course is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills required to design and implement mobile applications. Topics include: mobile design, mobile development, mobile security, and mobile management. Students will learn to design and implement mobile applications.
